channel.title: java.awt.Robot help
channel.description:
hello,
I wen't make a simple(realy simple) bot, but I need to learn how java.awt.Robot work...(If isn't the good class say me the good one)
I wen't to use robot in a applet for make virtual mouse and to can minimize the bot.
Gabuuzz

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:25, topic:238128”][quote author=henry link=topic=314360.msg2508182#msg2508182 date=1225139375]

Or you can just have a loader that acts exactly like a browser, such as Cherokee.

Mopar, this isnt meant to offend you, but lately you seem to really be pimping your Cherokee? Are you doing more work on it nowadays?
[/quote]

I work on it every now and then, if I ever get time I’ll write an updater and it will become a working bot. Until then, I post about it when people ask questions about how to do something that is already done undetectably and open source in Cherokee. I hope someone finds something in there helpful.[/quote]

Oh ok, I see. I haven’t looked at it very much, but the next chance I get I may look into it to see what you have done. It does seem quite promising, and I’m sure I’ll find some help from it.

Read full topic

Mopar, this isnt meant to offend you, but lately you seem to really be pimping your Cherokee? Are you doing more work on it nowadays?[/quote]

I work on it every now and then, if I ever get time I’ll write an updater and it will become a working bot. Until then, I post about it when people ask questions about how to do something that is already done undetectably and open source in Cherokee. I hope someone finds something in there helpful.

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Cheese_Police, post:19, topic:238128”][quote author=the bank link=topic=314360.msg2506250#msg2506250 date=1224939341]

SCAR doesnt nestle into your browser, does it.
[/quote]It runs on the browser. Doesn’t use a loader.

Last i checked atleast (like a year ago).

SCAR gets the window handle of the runescape applet and uses GDI (?) to obtain an image of it.[/quote]I see. Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:15, topic:238128”][quote author=the bank link=topic=314360.msg2505424#msg2505424 date=1224894112]

you need to manage more events than focus, mouse and keyboard to have a undetectable bot qauters

Not if your applet is part of a browser. Everything is handled by the browser except the focus/mouse/keyboard events (which are manged by my bot).
Also runescape most likely detects bad loaders etc, since the ban rate on RSBot was increasing pretty much lately.

Haven’t checked the client lately, but I guess it’s unlikely that they have a new client side detection method which figures out whether an applet is really on the foreground or not.
[/quote]Maybe it has to do with all your signlink crap in your loader. Even Speljohan said it was detectable.

Also, why do you output a [sL] file? I’m just curious.

It is detectable, but not the signlink crap
The official runescape loader does it exactly the same way, except it loads it’s own signlink.
The signlink I used came from the unsigned runescape jar, where the signlink file was different then the loader signlink.

I outputted it as an [sL] file, so the bot knew which class was singlink since I didn’t want to update the bot to use the new file every time.
But still it sucked and was supposed to be used as an temporarily solution.

I still believe the best bots are the bots who nestles into normal web browsers. (FireFox, IE etc) It would solve 80% of the detects. You most likely only get banned by bad scripts/reports/bad mouse patterns/botting for to long but nothing else :)[/quote]You mean like SCAR? Eww.

Why not just create a web component on a Frame? Wouldn’t be hard…just use the default IE plugins etc.

Or is that what you mean?

Read full topic

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:14, topic:238128”][quote author=qauters link=topic=314360.msg2504983#msg2504983 date=1224884370]

you need to manage more events than focus, mouse and keyboard to have a undetectable bot qauters

Not if your applet is part of a browser. Everything is handled by the browser except the focus/mouse/keyboard events (which are manged by my bot).
Also runescape most likely detects bad loaders etc, since the ban rate on RSBot was increasing pretty much lately.

Haven’t checked the client lately, but I guess it’s unlikely that they have a new client side detection method which figures out whether an applet is really on the foreground or not.
[/quote]Maybe it has to do with all your signlink crap in your loader. Even Speljohan said it was detectable.

Also, why do you output a [sL] file? I’m just curious.[/quote]
It is detectable, but not the signlink crap
The official runescape loader does it exactly the same way, except it loads it’s own signlink.
The signlink I used came from the unsigned runescape jar, where the signlink file was different then the loader signlink.

I outputted it as an [sL] file, so the bot knew which class was singlink since I didn’t want to update the bot to use the new file every time.
But still it sucked and was supposed to be used as an temporarily solution.

I still believe the best bots are the bots who nestles into normal web browsers. (FireFox, IE etc) It would solve 80% of the detects. You most likely only get banned by bad scripts/reports/bad mouse patterns/botting for to long but nothing else

Read full topic

you need to manage more events than focus, mouse and keyboard to have a undetectable bot qauters
[/quote]
Not if your applet is part of a browser. Everything is handled by the browser except the focus/mouse/keyboard events (which are manged by my bot).
Also runescape most likely detects bad loaders etc, since the ban rate on RSBot was increasing pretty much lately.

Haven’t checked the client lately, but I guess it’s unlikely that they have a new client side detection method which figures out whether an applet is really on the foreground or not.[/quote]Maybe it has to do with all your signlink crap in your loader. Even Speljohan said it was detectable.

Also, why do you output a [sL] file? I’m just curious.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

Not if your applet is part of a browser. Everything is handled by the browser except the focus/mouse/keyboard events (which are manged by my bot).
Also runescape most likely detects bad loaders etc, since the ban rate on RSBot was increasing pretty much lately.

Haven’t checked the client lately, but I guess it’s unlikely that they have a new client side detection method which figures out whether an applet is really on the foreground or not.

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“io9, post:10, topic:238128”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=314360.msg2501991#msg2501991 date=1224721963]
Send a fake minimize event?
[/quote]
Although that would be completely retarded because the bot will still send mouse events, in which case RS will be all, “WTF HAXER N CRAXER/”[/quote]
Not to mention there is no such thing as a minimize event for applets
You just minimize your applet viewer (the thing holding the applet).
As long as you don’t send a lostfocus event your safe

Read full topic

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @gabuuzz gabuuzz
item.description:
@gabuuzz wrote:

Moparisthebest:

You can’t use Robot if you want to minimize the applet and still send events to it because robot controls your actual keyboard and mouse. As Speljohan said you can send fake events to it, and if you want to not have to write those you can use the Keyboard and Mouse classes in cherokee: http://sourceforge.net/projects/cherokeeengine/ It is actually all set up and ready for you to script on runescape if that is what you want to do.

Thanx for the link it will help me.

But what will be the best class to minimize the applet?

Read full topic

item.title: java.awt.Robot help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can’t use Robot if you want to minimize the applet and still send events to it because robot controls your actual keyboard and mouse. As Speljohan said you can send fake events to it, and if you want to not have to write those you can use the Keyboard and Mouse classes in cherokee: http://sourceforge.net/projects/cherokeeengine/ It is actually all set up and ready for you to script on runescape if that is what you want to do.

Read full topic
